newsitem.title: USA: TCF Financial completes stock sale.
newsitem.headline: TCF Financial completes stock sale.

text.p: TCF Financial Corp said it has completed a public offering of 700,000 shares of its common stock at a price of $43.375 per share, which is related to its pending merger with Winthrop Resources Corp.
The merger is to be accounted for as a pooling of interests. Under the merger agreement, TCF was required to complete the sale of shares prior to consummation of the deal.

The net proceeds are to be used for the payment of a portion of the cash consideration related to its proposed merger of a TCF subsidiary Standard Financial Inc. If the merger with Standard does not occur, the proceeds will be used for working capital and for general corporate purposes.

TCF is a national bank holding company. Winthrop is a financial services company that leases computers, telecommunications equipment, point-of-sale systems and other business equipment. Standard is a thrift institution.
